scrollBehavior.description:
Where scroll behavior should originate.
- If set to `inside`, scroll only occurs within the `ModalBody`.
- If set to `outside`, the entire `ModalContent` will scroll within the viewport.
scrollBehavior.name: scrollBehavior

autoFocus.description:
If `true`, the modal will autofocus the first enabled and interactive
element within the `ModalContent`
autoFocus.name: autoFocus

isOpen.description: If `true`, the modal will be open.
isOpen.name: isOpen

onClose.description: Callback invoked to close the modal.
onClose.name: onClose

lockFocusAcrossFrames.description:
Enables aggressive focus capturing within iframes.
- If `true`: keep focus in the lock, no matter where lock is active
- If `false`:  allows focus to move outside of iframe
lockFocusAcrossFrames.name: lockFocusAcrossFrames

isCentered.description: If `true`, the modal will be centered on screen.
isCentered.name: isCentered

portalProps.description: Props to be forwarded to the portal component
portalProps.name: portalProps

motionPreset.description: The transition that should be used for the modal
motionPreset.name: motionPreset

closeOnOverlayClick.description: If `true`, the modal will close when the overlay is clicked
closeOnOverlayClick.name: closeOnOverlayClick

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the modal will close when the `Esc` key is pressed
closeOnEsc.name: closeOnEsc

onOverlayClick.description: Callback fired when the overlay is clicked.
onOverlayClick.name: onOverlayClick

onEsc.description: Callback fired when the escape key is pressed and focus is within modal
onEsc.name: onEsc

useInert.description:
A11y: If `true`, the siblings of the `modal` will have `aria-hidden`
set to `true` so that screen readers can only see the `modal`.

This is commonly known as making the other elements **inert**
useInert.name: useInert

trapFocus.description:
If `false`, focus lock will be disabled completely.

This is useful in situations where you still need to interact with
other surrounding elements.

ðŸš¨Warning: We don't recommend doing this because it hurts the
accessibility of the modal, based on WAI-ARIA specifications.
trapFocus.name: trapFocus

finalFocusRef.description: The `ref` of element to receive focus when the modal closes.
finalFocusRef.name: finalFocusRef

returnFocusOnClose.description: If `true`, the modal will return focus to the element that triggered it when it closes.
returnFocusOnClose.name: returnFocusOnClose

blockScrollOnMount.description: If `true`, scrolling will be disabled on the `body` when the modal opens.
blockScrollOnMount.name: blockScrollOnMount

allowPinchZoom.description:
Handle zoom/pinch gestures on iOS devices when scroll locking is enabled.
Defaults to `false`.
allowPinchZoom.name: allowPinchZoom

preserveScrollBarGap.description:
If `true`, a `padding-right` will be applied to the body element
that's equal to the width of the scrollbar.

This can help prevent some unpleasant flickering effect
and content adjustment when the modal opens
preserveScrollBarGap.name: preserveScrollBarGap
